snippet: The French foreign minister said tests confirmed that sarin gas had been used, and that there was “no doubt it was the regime.”
abstract: Frances says laboratory tests have confirmed that sarin gas has been used multiple times in Syria, but only in localized way; French Foreign Min Laurent Fabius says in one case, at least, that 'there is no doubt it was the regime and its accomplices' that used the gas.

byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER and NICK CUMMING-BRUCE
byline.contributor: Steven Erlanger reported from Paris, and Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva. Alan Cowell contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: The French foreign minister said tests confirmed that sarin gas had been used, and that there was “no doubt it was the regime.”

headline.main: France Offers Evidence of ‘Multiple’ Uses of Nerve Gas in Syria
headline.print_headline: France Offers Evidence of ‘Multiple’ Uses of Nerve Gas in Syria

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
